# Define a class to represent a primate
class Primate:
    def __init__(self, name):
        self.name = name

    def speak(self):
        print(f"{self.name} says 'Ooo Ooo Aaa Aaa'")

# Define a function to patch the speak method of Primate
def monkey_patching(primate_instance):
    def new_speak():
        print(f"{primate_instance.name} has learned human language!")
    primate_instance.speak = new_speak

# Create a primate instance
george = Primate("George")

# Original speak behavior
george.speak()

# Apply monkey patching to change the behavior
monkey_patching(george)

# New speak behavior
george.speak()

# Introduce an intentional error: a typo in the attribute name
def introduce_error(primate_instance):
    primate_instance.nme = "Curious George"

# Apply the erroneous function
introduce_error(george)

# Attempt to print the primate's name (will raise an AttributeError due to the typo)
print(george.name)
